intro: Campanula patens, commonly known as the spreading bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It features upright stems that can grow up to 3 feet tall, adorned with bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Campanula patens is known for its showy blooms and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
